newsitem.title: USA: Novartis buys Merck unit for $910 million.
newsitem.headline: Novartis buys Merck unit for $910 million.

text.p: Merck & Co. Inc. said on Tuesday it signed an agreement to sell its agricultural crop protection business to Novartis AG of Switzerland for $910 million.
The unit makes products that protect crops against mites, insects and fungi.

In December, Merck announced plans to sell its crop protection business as part of its joint venture with France's Rhone-Poulenc that combined their animal health and poultry genetics businesses into a new company, called Merial.
Novartis said the deal includes the worldwide rights to the Merck unit's business, which had sales of $200 million last year.
Basel, Switzerland-based Novartis is a leader in crop protection, which accounted for 73 percent of its 1996 agribusiness sales of $5.2 billion.
Novartis will offer employment to nearly all Merck crop protection employees, Merck said.
The acquisition is expected to be completed this summer.
